attributes.action: Make Scottish banknotes legal UK tender
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Info from BBC.

Scottish banknotes should be legally protected in England to stop them being rejected. 

Alistair Carmichael, the Liberal Democrats' Scottish affairs spokesman, said it was time for a change.

The Orkney and Shetland MP said: "It is ironic that many shops and businesses in London have signs indicating that they will accept euros."

A Treasury spokesperson said the term legal tender did not govern the acceptability of banknotes.

"Only Bank of England notes have the status of legal tender in England and Wales," the spokesperson said.

"However, the term legal tender does not govern the acceptability of banknotes in transactions.

"Whether or not notes have legal tender status, their acceptability as a means of payment is essentially a matter for agreement between the parties involved, which the Government does not currently regulate."

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
